concise_definition: adv. 当然, 无疑, 肯定地

definitions.explanation_en: Used to express strong agreement, affirmation, or confidence in a statement, often in response to a request or question.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于表达强烈的同意、肯定或对某陈述的信心，常用于回应请求或问题。
definitions.example_en: Can you help me with this report? Certainly!
definitions.example_cn: 你能帮我处理这份报告吗？当然可以！

definitions.explanation_en: Used to indicate that something is definitely true or will definitely happen, emphasizing certainty without doubt.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于表明某事毫无疑问为真或必将发生，强调确定性，毫无怀疑。
definitions.example_en: He will certainly win the election given his popularity.
definitions.example_cn: 鉴于他的人气，他肯定会赢得选举。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to soften or politely reinforce a response, often in formal or courteous contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于在正式或礼貌语境中缓和语气，使回应更委婉而坚定。
definitions.example_en: I would certainly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the city.
definitions.example_cn: 我肯定会向任何来这座城市的人推荐这家餐厅。

comparison.analysis: “Definitely” (明确地) 与 “certainly” 非常接近，都表示确定性，但 “definitely” 更强调事实层面的明确无误，语气更直接、更果断；而 “certainly” 常带有礼貌、温和的色彩，更常用于人际互动中表达愿意配合或同意。
“Surely” (想必/当然) 常用于表达基于常识或逻辑的推断，有时隐含轻微的惊讶或质疑（如：Surely you’re joking?）。它比 “certainly” 更主观，不确定性略高；而 “certainly” 更坚定，较少用于质疑语境。
“Absolutely” (绝对地) 表达的是最高程度的肯定，语气更强、更情绪化，常用于强调极端或无条件的认同。而 “certainly” 更中性、克制，适用于正式或日常语境，不带有强烈情感色彩。
